column4: can someone tell me: in order to backup my settings and stuff - do I need openads-client or something else ?
openafs-client*
duplicity is nice
okay, thank you!
in order to backup system with duplicity, I need to type source as "/" ?
or /dev/sda1 ? :]
I think either, I always use the former though.
okay thankee! :]
I got "gpg: WARNING: unsafe ownership on configuration file `/home/hagane/.gnupg/gpg.conf'
Do you have a GPG key?
no what's that ? :D
it asked smth, I wrote some pass, and retyped it.
as I understand this is for web servers and etc, but can I save image on my hard ? I don't have any http or local network PC or anything
rsync can use the local system as destination too.
so I made this gnu key, what does it have to do with duplicity anyway ? no matter what I write when it asks to enter (and confirm) the outcome i that error..
You wanted to encrypt your files... you need a way to decrypt it... else it'd be like a safe without a lock  ;)
I just wanted to make a backup on another drive, and I ended up totally confused making some key I don't even fully understand what for..
I distinctly recall you said you wanted to encrypt a tar.gz .... about 5 hours ago  :P
lol no wai, I asked what prog is good for backing up - and you said duplicity...

ahh... well duplicity is about the best tool for backups too... you just get some security added in so no one tampers with them... it's really easy once you create a key... you should be signing e-mails and stuff with it anyways, to ensure it's really you etc...
Once you get the key set up, you get many benefits from it... seems complicated, but it's really not
well I got it
it's written FTP and stuff, but how to save backup on my hdd ? I tried this and that, but don't understand how... and don't see it written anywhere
